articles.title: Herdman reflects, takes blame following Canada’s World Cup loss to Croatia - Sportsnet.ca
articles.description: "I'll take it on the chin," John Herdman said after being asked about his much spoken about comments regarding Croatia. Following his loss to the European side, he had to confront his words head-on.
articles.content: Canada's head coach John Herdman gives instructions from the side line during the World Cup match between Croatia and Canada, at the Khalifa International Stadium in Doha, Qatar, Sunday, Nov. 27, 202… [+28 chars]

articles.author: Contributor
articles.title: Research shines spotlight on eye worm infection in European horses - Horsetalk
articles.description: Thelaziosis infections often produce no obvious signs. However, inflammation of the conjunctiva and eyelids can occur, and more severe cases may show inflammation, swelling, and cloudiness of the cornea.

articles.author: RFE/RL's Siberia.Realities
articles.title: 'We're Dying Like Flies': Remote Russian Village Grapples With Shortage Of Men Amid Putin's War In Ukraine - Radio Free Europe / Radio Liberty
articles.description: In a small village in Russia's Far East, a significant portion of military-age men were mobilized for President Vladimir Putin's war in Ukraine. RFE/RL reports firsthand on the impact of the war in this remote and impoverished settlement.
articles.content:
BUKACHACHA, Russia Andrei Epov ferries passengers to the small Siberian village of Bukachacha by bus from the nearest major city, the regional capital, Chita.
Set deep in the taiga, the village of 1… [+9319 chars]

articles.title: Qatar's migrant workers enjoy World Cup on the cheap - DAWN.com
articles.description: They bristle at European media suggestions that they are “fake fans”.
articles.content: Shafeeq Saqafi paid $3 for the Argentina shirt he proudly wore when he sat with 15,000 other migrant workers in a hidden corner of Doha to watch Lionel Messis side salvage their World Cup on Saturday… [+2897 chars]

articles.title: Hubble Space Telescope image shows galaxies merge 671M light-years away - New York Post
articles.description: Scientists at NASA and the European Space Agency (ESA) released an image on Friday showcasing a pair of merging galaxies.
articles.content:
Scientists at NASA and the European Space Agency (ESA) released an image on Friday showcasing a pair of merging galaxies. 
The galaxy merger, known as Arp-Madore 417-391, is located 671 million ligh… [+817 chars]
